text: The Venerable William Powell, D.D. was an Anglican priest in England during the 17th Century." The History and Antiquities of the Church and City of Lichfield" Harwood, T. p214: Glocester; Cadell & Davies; 1806 By Thomas Harwood Helme was born in Wiltshire and educated at Merton College, Oxford.Alumni Oxonienses 1500-1714, Hawten-Hider He was appointed Fellow in 1564 and Praelector in 1578. He held the living at Bredon from 1607 and was Archdeacon of Derby from 1609 until his deprivation in 1617. Helme died in 1628. == Notes == Category:Alumni of Merton College, Oxford Category:Archdeacons of Bath Category:People from Wiltshire Category:17th- century English Anglican priests Category:1628 deaths
title: Christopher Helme (priest)
